article_title: Texas Senate considers 'Scarlet Letter' Obamacare bill
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

og.description: The Texas Senate will vote on a bill that would require insurance cards to display the letter QHP if a plan was bought on the Obamacare insurance marketplace. Doctors are supporting the bill so they won't get stuck with unpaid claims under a 90-day grace period. But critics calling it the Scarlet Letter bill say it will lead to patient discrimination.
og.title: Texas Senate considers 'Scarlet Letter' Obamacare bill
